alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 12:49PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...INCREASING POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT SNOW LATE THIS WEEK ACROSS PARTS OF SOUTHEAST ALASKA... With cold temperatures continuing through late week under the current strong Arctic high pressure system, conditions are becoming favorable for significant heavy snowfall across portions of the central and southern Panhandle late this week. The heavy snowfall is projected to start in the southern Panhandle late Thursday, then spread northward through the Icy Strait corridor Friday into Saturday. Confidence is increasing that portions of the panhandle will see greater than 6 inches of snow in 12 hours with over 12 inches in 24 hours Friday and Saturday. Through the weekend, the central and northern Panhandle look most favorable to see the greatest accumulations, in particular communities along the Icy Strait corridor, as the southern Panhandle will see a change over to rain sometime late Friday night. Although confidence is increasing in significant snowfall, changes to the exact snowfall amounts are expected as more details become available and refined. Stay tuned for additional statements and possible Winter Storm Watches later this week across Southeast Alaska.
